story:
Elephants are some of the most intelligent and emotionally complex animals on Earth. Elephants are important because they are a keystone species: without them, entire ecosystems cease to exist.  

But today elephants are in danger and it is the last chance we have to save them. With one elephant being killed for its ivory tusks every 15 minutes, almost 100 per day, these majestic, iconic creatures could be extinct within the decade.  

Elephants are being killed at an unprecedented rate for their ivory tusks to meet the demand from China. Today, the price of Ivory has skyrocketed, fetching thousands of dollars for a pair. The following figure shows how Ivory from Africa reaches China and all the other countries through a very complicated supply channel.

While many efforts are underway to reduce the ivory demand, brought on by the increasingly wealthy Chinese middle class, there is still an enormous amount of work that needs to be done to limit the supply. One of the largest contributing factors that need to be addressed is the extreme poverty that exists in many African countries. If people are unable to provide for their families, any job will do, even if that job is poaching. For poachers, elephants are worth way more dead than they are alive.


Our mission at Elephant Pie is to reverse that thinking by providing income opportunities to the locals. We have to make them realize that AN ELEPHANT IS WORTH WAY MORE ALIVE THAN DEAD.

How did we design the products?

Having developed the paper, we were faced with two challenges.
1. To develop products made from the dung paper that are practical & creative enough to ensure a continuous demand so as to make it possible for us to procure dung and pay the locals.

2. To make products that can spread awareness and educate people about the crisis at hand. 

Help us inspire locals to fight against the horrors of poaching to save the elephants! Don't let us be on the wrong side of history. Make a stand and support this project by pledging, sharing the project with your friends and spreading awareness about the crisis.

Everybody needs a place on their desk to store pens and display business cards. But what if your pen/card holder was multi-functional AND helped support elephant conservation efforts, too?  Named after the Greek goddess Artemis, the protector of wild animals, our desk ornament functions as a Pen Holder, Vase, Business Card Holder, and Docking Station! At 7.9” high, this graceful beauty made of fine Poly resin will enhance your desk/home and be a visual reminder of your love of elephants!

ARTEMIS can be completely personalized with a combination of words (a maximum of 20 letters) and logos as shown in the photos below.

You can send your logo/text in any format. Our design team will render a picture of ARTEMIS with your logo/text and send for approval. The reward also includes up to two revisions.

According to recent estimates, more than 10 billion business cards are printed in the U.S. every year, while 80% of the cards distributed are discarded within a week. However, the remaining 20% really do work. For every 2,000 cards distributed, it is estimated that sales increase by about 2.5%.

You can upload your existing design or send us your logo and details. Our team will design the best card for you and offer up to 2 revisions.

Elephant Pie offers three beautiful journals: A Tribute to Qumquat; 10 Years Until Extinction; and Keep Calm and Go Vegan. Each journal is bound with a hard cover and is made of 100gsm elephant dung paper with a smooth, double-rolled finish. The journals are available in three page formats: both pages lined; one page lined and the opposing page blank; both pages blank. Each notebook is 100% vegan (just like elephants!) and measure 8.3”x 5.8”.

My Elephant Activity Book has a range of fun-filled activities to educate children about elephants and teach empathy for other sentient beings.
Contains a range of Creative Puzzles, Mazes, Coloring Pages, Stories, Word Searches etc, to help kids learn in a fun way.

Never lose your place in a book or magazine again! These adorable bookmarks are made of durable elephant dung cardboard and measure 4" long. There are five sweet designs - three elephants and two trees - and come in two packs.


This reward will give you an opportunity to experience a trip of a lifetime. A five day Safari will be provided by one of the top tourist companies in Tanzania along with a visit to Elephant Pie's collection Center.
This package includes air fare, accommodation, travelling & food.

This mini version is designed with a few limitations keeping the environment and eco-system in consideration. 
1. A complete set CANNOT process more than 150 kg of dung a day. This is roughly equal to the dung coming from three elephants.
2. Sale is limited to sanctuaries/organizations involved in conserving elephants. A sanctuary/organization will not be sold more than one complete set.
3. We will not be selling the set to any Zoo or place holding captive elephants.

Making paper from dung is a very simple process. Pulp is the primary raw material of the paper industry. While the conventional paper-making industry uses tree pulp to make paper, it can easily be replaced by other environment-friendly sources like dung. Elephant dung is especially suited for making pulp because elephants are poor digesters – the majority of the more than 250 pounds of their daily vegetarian diet is passed as undigested plant fiber, which is long enough to be converted into pulp!

Making paper from the dung is a simple six-step process: 
1.The dung is collected and dried.
2. It is boiled for eight hours using a few disinfectants to remove all the bacteria.
3. It is then crushed to make pulp.
4. The pulp is separated based on mesh size and sifted over wooden frames to achieve the required paper thickness.
5. The sheets are sun dried and then wrapped around hot air tubes to remove the moisture and dust completely. 
6. Sheets are sprayed with a special finishing agent and double-rolled to achieve the required finish and texture.


WHERE ARE WE SO FAR?

Over the last one year, we have worked really hard on developing this paper to make it smooth and user friendly so that it is easy for people to replace their tree pulp paper with elephant dung paper and support the cause. A special 3 rolled calendar was fabricated to achieve this purpose. 

As shown in the picture, second and third roll have steam inlets making it possible to take the surface temperature to more than 100 C. This helps in embedding any fibers on the surface and resulting in a smooth finish.

We took a major stride in our development process when we tried adding a 5 micron natural filler to our pulp. This resulted in a very smooth texture and also helped in improving the color of the paper. We are really thankful to our consultant Mr. Richard James for his support.

An interesting aspect of our equipment is that it is completely portable. The machines were fabricated in a way that packing them up from one location and installing in a new place is very easy and takes less than a day. All the machines except for the boiler are plug and play. The boiler is connected to the mixing bath (dung and water is mixed and boiled for 8 hours) and the tube dryer through steam pipes (takes less than an hour to weld). The boiler is also designed in a way that it has a kiln connected to the chamber housing the tubes. The kiln is fabricated with the view of using cow dung/other environment friendly solid waste as a source of fuel.

We have also finalized a location in the village of Minjingu, Tanzania to kickstart our first dung collection center. 

Bulk production of ARTEMIS will take place in Taiwan. We have developed a very strong relationship with the manufacturer & have forwarded the STL files so that they can work on them and make their molds. Once the project ends, the manufacturer will be able to start the production immediately.

We have the process developed, we have the equipment, but we need to reach out and gather support or else the true purpose of this project falls short. We need to show that there is a demand for change, a demand for action, a demand for alternative and viable ways for locals to support themselves.

Websites

www.elephantpie.org

www.MarchforElephants.org

Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/ElePie

https://www.facebook.com/GiveAShitAboutElephants

Twitter

https://twitter.com/ElephantPie2

This project wouldn't have been possible without the support of following people.

Maria Mossman (London) for her suggestions & support
Judy Maxwell (British Columbia) for always being there to support the elephants and this project
Barbara Garrett (San Francisco) for her valuable editing
Virginia Woolf (Auckland) for letting us use her poem 
Aafeez Jivraj (Arusha) for highlighting the areas worst hit by poaching
Mr Kamal Ahmed (Arusha) for his commitment to this project
Mr Patirana (Sri Lanka) for helping & training our staff and giving us valuable insights into the art of paper making.
Mr Richard James( Manchester, UK) for providing us the consultancy and sharing his knowledge with us.

Risks and Challenges 

We have worked really hard in eliminating all the potential obstacles. Shipping was seen as a possible hurdle but after going through a list of shipping agents, we have finalized the best agent to handle the logistics of our products to and from Tanzania.

We have also figured out a plan for shipping the rewards. Since paper products are generally heavy to ship, we have decided to ship the rewards from two countries to avoid high shipping costs and delays. Rewards for the US and Canada will be shipped from New York while rewards for the UK, Europe and the rest of the world will be shipped from Manchester.

There are inherent challenges with projects of this nature. While we feel that we have reduced the variables as much as possible, they can never be completely eliminated. But we are confident that after a year of working so hard on this project, we are ready to eliminate any obstacle and make this project a success.

If you’d like to donate, any amount helps. Please scroll back up to the top of the page and choose a perk to support Elephant Pie on the right-hand side. Thank you for your support!!!
story_txt:
Elephants are some of the most intelligent and emotionally complex animals on Earth. Elephants are important because they are a keystone species: without them, entire ecosystems cease to exist.  But today elephants are in danger and it is the last chance we have to save them. With one elephant being killed for its ivory tusks every 15 minutes, almost 100 per day, these majestic, iconic creatures could be extinct within the decade.  Elephants are being killed at an unprecedented rate for their ivory tusks to meet the demand from China. Today, the price of Ivory has skyrocketed, fetching thousands of dollars for a pair. The following figure shows how Ivory from Africa reaches China and all the other countries through a very complicated supply channel.While many efforts are underway to reduce the ivory demand, brought on by the increasingly wealthy Chinese middle class, there is still an enormous amount of work that needs to be done to limit the supply. One of the largest contributing factors that need to be addressed is the extreme poverty that exists in many African countries. If people are unable to provide for their families, any job will do, even if that job is poaching. For poachers, elephants are worth way more dead than they are alive.Our mission at Elephant Pie is to reverse that thinking by providing income opportunities to the locals. We have to make them realize that AN ELEPHANT IS WORTH WAY MORE ALIVE THAN DEAD.How did we design the products?Having developed the paper, we were faced with two challenges.1. To develop products made from the dung paper that are practical & creative enough to ensure a continuous demand so as to make it possible for us to procure dung and pay the locals.2. To make products that can spread awareness and educate people about the crisis at hand. Help us inspire locals to fight against the horrors of poaching to save the elephants! Don't let us be on the wrong side of history. Make a stand and support this project by pledging, sharing the project with your friends and spreading awareness about the crisis.Everybody needs a place on their desk to store pens and display business cards. But what if your pen/card holder was multi-functional AND helped support elephant conservation efforts, too?  Named after the Greek goddess Artemis, the protector of wild animals, our desk ornament functions as a Pen Holder, Vase, Business Card Holder, and Docking Station! At 7.9” high, this graceful beauty made of fine Poly resin will enhance your desk/home and be a visual reminder of your love of elephants!ARTEMIS can be completely personalized with a combination of words (a maximum of 20 letters) and logos as shown in the photos below.You can send your logo/text in any format. Our design team will render a picture of ARTEMIS with your logo/text and send for approval. The reward also includes up to two revisions.According to recent estimates, more than 10 billion business cards are printed in the U.S. every year, while 80% of the cards distributed are discarded within a week. However, the remaining 20% really do work. For every 2,000 cards distributed, it is estimated that sales increase by about 2.5%.You can upload your existing design or send us your logo and details. Our team will design the best card for you and offer up to 2 revisions.
Elephant Pie offers three beautiful journals: A Tribute to Qumquat; 10 Years Until Extinction; and Keep Calm and Go Vegan. Each journal is bound with a hard cover and is made of 100gsm elephant dung paper with a smooth, double-rolled finish. The journals are available in three page formats: both pages lined; one page lined and the opposing page blank; both pages blank. Each notebook is 100% vegan (just like elephants!) and measure 8.3”x 5.8”.My Elephant Activity Book has a range of fun-filled activities to educate children about elephants and teach empathy for other sentient beings.Contains a range of Creative Puzzles, Mazes, Coloring Pages, Stories, Word Searches etc, to help kids learn in a fun way.Never lose your place in a book or magazine again! These adorable bookmarks are made of durable elephant dung cardboard and measure 4" long. There are five sweet designs - three elephants and two trees - and come in two packs.This reward will give you an opportunity to experience a trip of a lifetime. A five day Safari will be provided by one of the top tourist companies in Tanzania along with a visit to Elephant Pie's collection Center.This package includes air fare, accommodation, travelling & food.This mini version is designed with a few limitations keeping the environment and eco-system in consideration. 1. A complete set CANNOT process more than 150 kg of dung a day. This is roughly equal to the dung coming from three elephants.2. Sale is limited to sanctuaries/organizations involved in conserving elephants. A sanctuary/organization will not be sold more than one complete set.3. We will not be selling the set to any Zoo or place holding captive elephants.Making paper from dung is a very simple process. Pulp is the primary raw material of the paper industry. While the conventional paper-making industry uses tree pulp to make paper, it can easily be replaced by other environment-friendly sources like dung. Elephant dung is especially suited for making pulp because elephants are poor digesters – the majority of the more than 250 pounds of their daily vegetarian diet is passed as undigested plant fiber, which is long enough to be converted into pulp!Making paper from the dung is a simple six-step process: 1.The dung is collected and dried.2. It is boiled for eight hours using a few disinfectants to remove all the bacteria.3. It is then crushed to make pulp.4. The pulp is separated based on mesh size and sifted over wooden frames to achieve the required paper thickness.5. The sheets are sun dried and then wrapped around hot air tubes to remove the moisture and dust completely. 6. Sheets are sprayed with a special finishing agent and double-rolled to achieve the required finish and texture.WHERE ARE WE SO FAR?Over the last one year, we have worked really hard on developing this paper to make it smooth and user friendly so that it is easy for people to replace their tree pulp paper with elephant dung paper and support the cause. A special 3 rolled calendar was fabricated to achieve this purpose. As shown in the picture, second and third roll have steam inlets making it possible to take the surface temperature to more than 100 C. This helps in embedding any fibers on the surface and resulting in a smooth finish.We took a major stride in our development process when we tried adding a 5 micron natural filler to our pulp. This resulted in a very smooth texture and also helped in improving the color of the paper. We are really thankful to our consultant Mr. Richard James for his support.An interesting aspect of our equipment is that it is completely portable. The machines were fabricated in a way that packing them up from one location and installing in a new place is very easy and takes less than a day. All the machines except for the boiler are plug and play. The boiler is connected to the mixing bath (dung and water is mixed and boiled for 8 hours) and the tube dryer through steam pipes (takes less than an hour to weld). The boiler is also designed in a way that it has a kiln connected to the chamber housing the tubes. The kiln is fabricated with the view of using cow dung/other environment friendly solid waste as a source of fuel.We have also finalized a location in the village of Minjingu, Tanzania to kickstart our first dung collection center. Bulk production of ARTEMIS will take place in Taiwan. We have developed a very strong relationship with the manufacturer & have forwarded the STL files so that they can work on them and make their molds. Once the project ends, the manufacturer will be able to start the production immediately.We have the process developed, we have the equipment, but we need to reach out and gather support or else the true purpose of this project falls short. We need to show that there is a demand for change, a demand for action, a demand for alternative and viable ways for locals to support themselves.Websiteswww.elephantpie.orgwww.MarchforElephants.orgFacebookhttps://www.facebook.com/ElePiehttps://www.facebook.com/GiveAShitAboutElephantsTwitterhttps://twitter.com/ElephantPie2This project wouldn't have been possible without the support of following people.Maria Mossman (London) for her suggestions & supportJudy Maxwell (British Columbia) for always being there to support the elephants and this projectBarbara Garrett (San Francisco) for her valuable editingVirginia Woolf (Auckland) for letting us use her poem Aafeez Jivraj (Arusha) for highlighting the areas worst hit by poachingMr Kamal Ahmed (Arusha) for his commitment to this projectMr Patirana (Sri Lanka) for helping & training our staff and giving us valuable insights into the art of paper making.Mr Richard James( Manchester, UK) for providing us the consultancy and sharing his knowledge with us.Risks and Challenges We have worked really hard in eliminating all the potential obstacles. Shipping was seen as a possible hurdle but after going through a list of shipping agents, we have finalized the best agent to handle the logistics of our products to and from Tanzania.We have also figured out a plan for shipping the rewards. Since paper products are generally heavy to ship, we have decided to ship the rewards from two countries to avoid high shipping costs and delays. Rewards for the US and Canada will be shipped from New York while rewards for the UK, Europe and the rest of the world will be shipped from Manchester.There are inherent challenges with projects of this nature. While we feel that we have reduced the variables as much as possible, they can never be completely eliminated. But we are confident that after a year of working so hard on this project, we are ready to eliminate any obstacle and make this project a success.If you’d like to donate, any amount helps. Please scroll back up to the top of the page and choose a perk to support Elephant Pie on the right-hand side. Thank you for your support!!!

story:
With PocketMaker,you can print almost anything.

                                                          All you need is creativity.

                                                The Pocketmaker is for everyone.

            We designed it to be perfect for beginner users but also for expert users.

                       You can not only print your own 3D model on your computer

                                             but also connect your phone to print.

                                             PocketMaker use replaceable nozzles,

                                  so you never have to worry about nozzle clogging.

You can use PLA or ABS, as well as our pocket filament spools or other standard 1.75 mm filament spools available on the market.

We specially designed pocket PLA filament spools so that people can print with more materials and color choices. 

 
  • Printe volume: It's a cube,  80 mm (3.15 in) per side.
  • It is lightweight, roughly 850g (1.87 lb). 
  • Replaceable nozzle.
  • Removable Print Bed.
  • Print accuracy:0.2mm.
  • Wireless connection. 
  • USB-Compatible connection.
  • It can be used with Android, iOS, Windows，or Mac.
  • Filament: standard 1.75mm. Nearly  160 g(0.35lb) rolls.
  • Supports many different materials:  PLA [Recommended],ABS,Nylon,TPU.
  • Other standard 1.75 mm filament spools on the market also supported.
  • PocketMaker APP for an effortless, plug-and-play experience.  
  • Supports and uses open source software (for advanced users)

 

How did we achieve such a low price?​

We think that everyone could have the access to 3d printing.Our mission was to make 3D printing simple and affordable.We redesigned and customized the motor while leaving only the essential structure needed for stable, quality 3D printing to make it truly affordable and completely effortless to use.We know that some point in the future 3D printing must be a part of everyone’s lives. 

We rewarded  our supporters with PocketMaker for only $129,but the retail price for PocketMaker will be $149.

 

Risks and challenges

As with any innovative project, we face several key risks and challenges.

In production, our parts will be made using injection molding and other processes. For a high-quality machine, we require precise parts,which means that we need to secure a very reliable manufacture partner that will deliver great quality. We have talked to many reliable manufacturers in Shenzhen who would like to support our production.

 If any inaccuracies occur，we will have to go back and tool them again. So there is typically a 45day lead time to fabricate the molds,and this is where delays may occur because we strictly demand the best quality for our parts.We will not release a printer that doesn't meet our high standards.To prevent this delay, we have also been working hard with mold design specialists.

 

 

Thanks for reading about our project and hopefully we can hand over our PocketMaker to you in the near future. 

 

 

If you have any questions,please get in touch with us.We will be happy to answer all you questions.

PocketMaker3d@gmail.com

https://twitter.com/PocketMaker3d

http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBEyTR-3oQ3WIpzGK4jamQg

 

 

FAQ

What type of file does PocketMaker print?
PocketMaker prints STL files, the most common 3D model format in 3D printing.
 

How is The PocketMaker powered？
Each PocketMaker will be shipped with a power supply compatible with the customer's local power: E.g. If you live in a country with 220V you will get a supply that runs at 220V.

 

Where can I order more Pocket PLA filaments after Indiegogo campaign?
You can order more Pocket PLA filaments through the PocketMaker app.
 

Does PocketMaker work with open source slicing software?
Yes.
 

How can I get the print models?
There are two ways you can obtain 3d models: 
1. The PocketMaker App provides 3D models that can easily be printed using our “One-Touch-Print” function. 
2. PocketMaker’s official website (under construction) will provide software and thousands of 3D models.
 

I am a media reporter, who do I contact?
We’d love to help answer all of your questions. Please contact us at PocketMaker3d@gmail.com

 

Will PocketMaker be on the market after the campaign is over？

PocketMaker will be available on the market in June 2017.

story:
Fidgeters of the world unite! Introducing Masta Box, a fidget gadget that will change the way you think about fidget toys forever! Masta Box is an Air Mouse, a Joystick, a Presenter (with Laser Pointer)and a Micro SD card reader.

 

Fidget toys are nothing new, and they have served one function well - satisfying the need to fidget. The team at Masta Box wants more - we have re-engineered an ordinary fidget cube and made it a Bluetooth device that is packed with general functions, all in a compact cube.

At Masta Box, we are all certified Class-A fidgeters. Fidgeters get attached to their little fidget toys and bring them everywhere they go. That's why we make Masta Box. It saves us from packing another device by combining a seemingly simple fidget cube with the functions of a universal Bluetooth controller. With Masta Box, you can do many cool and useful things both at home and at work.

Masta Box is compatible with both PC and Mac via Bluetooth 4.2. It works as a universal controller for presentation, browsing the Internet, playing music and video, last but not least - a perfect fidget toy!

 

 

 The MASTA BOX project is incredibly designed to maximize its full potential. With all components fitting perfectly into a few cubic inches.

Masta Box 3D design diagram

Masta Box Exploded View

 
            
Magnetic cable: Type C + Type A + Lightning, 1m, charing and transfer data: CA$ 23 US $18
 64G Micro Card : CA$ 23 US $18
Protective Case: CA$13 US$10
 

Alliance for quality assurance of crowdfunding's product development

 

 

Since 2012, Backercamp has helped over 5,000 projects become a reality.

Way to achieve your GOAL for your crowdfunding campaign.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our Matsa Box team are all very excited about to bring this project alive, we have tackled a lot of challenges in order to turn a conceptual idea to a production working prototype.

We believe there will be bigger challenges ahead when we move to the mass production, but our team will make all our effort to assure the quality and production line run smoothly.

story:
Meet iFu BS1 Electric Screwdriver

Small size, big power, it is the perfect replacement for all your manual screwdrivers and other small electric screwdrivers.

 

Boasting a strong brushless motor and a set of brilliantly designed gears made from high strength alloy, iFu BS1 is the most powerful electric screwdriver of its size. With 3 adjustable speeds and a meticulous selection of bits (a tube of 20 extra bits available for BS1 Pro and BS1 Combo), it could work on objects big and small, from delicate electronics, toys, home appliances to furniture, light fixture, doors & windows, and even bikes. 

 

Compact

The cap/bit holder houses 8 bits inside, plus one on the screwdriver already, you’ve got 9 carefully selected bits, which are sufficient for over 80% applications around the house, without carrying an extra case, pouch or anything.

 

Small

29.9mm in diameter and 177mm in length, of the size of a marker and the weight of a cellphone, BS1 is very easy to carry/store and extremely handy.

 

Yet powerful

iFu BS1 features 3 adjustable speeds (with a max of 260rpm), and boasts a torque of up to 1.0Nm. In the rare case where you need more than that, drive it manually and the torque goes as high as 5Nm. The transition from electric to manual is seamless, so you can work in safety and efficiency. 

 

Other Features & Characteristics

Smart Overdrive Protection

iFu BS1 stops automatically when it reaches the highest torque, so you don’t need to worry about stripping the screw or damaging your device/the screwdriver itself.

Ergonomic & Child Safe

The marker sized cylinder body of iFu BS1 is friendly to all hand sizes. You can grab it in whatever fashion you want without getting tired even after working it a long time. The anti-slip dull polish ensures comfortable touch and strong grip.

 

Intuitive Operating

3 keys are strategically positioned at your figure tip. No instructions needed, anyone can just pick it up and start working.

LED Shadow-less Lighting

The screwdriver incorporates 3 LED lights to provide you shadowless light, which works in one of these 3 modes:

Manual Lighting: You decide when it goes on and off;

Simultaneous Lighting: It automatically goes on and off together with the screwdriver;

No Lighting: In most cases, you don’t really need the LED for extra lighting.

 

Battery Charging

As almost all small electric/electronic devices of our time, BS1 has a high density battery inside and supports USB to USB Type-C charging. On a single charge, it

  • Drives/Undrives 300 40mm M3 Machine screws;
  • Spins 100min load-free;
  • Stands by 180 days.

 

3 Speeds / Child mode

iFu BS1 features 3 adjustable speeds and is able to lock into the selected speed. It doesn’t only cater your different screwdriving needs but is also safe for a kid to operate in a lower speed (Adult’s supervision advised). Making/breaking things is the way children learn, so help them make/fix stuff and spend some quality parent-child time together.

 

Compatibility

iFu BS1 sports a 6.3mm universal bit port, and comes with a 6.3-4.0mm converter and a 110mm extension pole. So it’s compatible with a whole lot different sizes of bits and is able to reach most hard-to-reach locations. 

 

The Creative Process

 

Variations

BS1

iFu BS1 comes in 2 colors, white and grey, and with 9 careful selected bits, 1 on the screwdriver and 8 in the bit holder/cap.

 

BS1 Pro

iFu BS1 comes with 9 careful selected bits, 1 on the screwdriver and 8 in the bit holder/cap. BS1 Pro comes with an extra tube of 20 bits. All the bits are made of S2 high strength steel and are chrome plated, extremely resistant to rusting. 

 

Specifications

 

Demonstration

 

 

What's in the Box (of BS1)?

 

Media Feature

 

Timeline

 

Behind the Scene

Bevis Long likes to roll up his sleeves and get hands-on, so he makes and fixes most of his stuff in and around his house. Years ago, after learning about magnet and electromagnetic induction principle in a science class in primary school, he cracked open his father’s beloved tape recorder just to see how loudspeakers work. Being found out, he was very afraid that dad would punish him. To his surprise, his father didn’t, but instead encouraged him to put the machine back together and make it work again. Now a father himself, he encourages his children to make, break and fix things, and he spares as much time as possible to do this with them. “This is the way we bond and how they learn.” He found in the market electric screwdrivers big, for professional, heavy duty uses, and small, for electronics, but nothing in between. That’s when the idea of iFu BS1 came into being. With his kids in mind, he made sure it is safe for children as well.

Years ago, after learning about magnet and electromagnetic induction principle in a science class in primary school, he cracked open his father’s beloved tape recorder just to see how loudspeakers work. Being found out, he was very afraid that dad would punish him. To his surprise, his father didn’t, but instead encouraged him to put the machine back together and make it work again. Now a father himself, he encourages his children to make, break and fix things, and he spares as much time as possible to do this with them. “This is the way we bond and how they learn.” He found in the market electric screwdrivers big, for professional, heavy duty uses, and small, for electronics, but nothing in between. That’s when the idea of iFu BS1 came into being. With his kids in mind, he made sure it is safe for children as well.

story:
Your support will help youth participate in the Social Justice Youth camp - one of the most unique and diverse social change programs for youth in the country!

Imagine taking youth from all over Atlantic Canada and supporting their learning and sharing around social and environmental justice issues such as poverty, racism, labour rights and gender identity.  Imagine them doing this in an environment where there are youth from all over Atlantic Canada representing different racial identities, cultures, geographies, classes, gender spectrums and religious affiliations.  Then imagine what can happen!

This is what we have been doing for the past 12 years! And we need your help. The Social Justice Youth Camp (August 25th - 29th at the Tatamagouche Centre in Nova Scotia) brings together young people, aged 15-19 from disparate communities to begin to experience creating the world in which they want to live.  For five days, youth explore issues such as identity, climate change, racism and advocacy, while they develop skills and networks and connections that are going to impact our region for years to come. Then they go home and make that change happen!

Imagine if you could be a part of this?

Now you can be!

Be a part of the difference and the change in our future.

We need support to make this happen. We welcome contributions of $5.00 to $5000.00 (okay, maybe a bit ambitious. But hey, ya gotta ask...). It costs $450.00 for one youth to attend. So you might want to consider that too!

Share this with others, spread the word, join the change!

More SJYC info at: www.socialjusticeyouthcamp.wordpress.com

More info on the Tatamagouche Centre at: www.tatacentre.ca

story:
I thought to myself, "Hey! We all have dreams but we never get to talk about them like we talk about who won the Red Sox game!" This app allows you to connect with people all over the world by sharing the dreams you previously had! You are able to create a visualization of the dream by dragging and dropping Emoij's onto a plain or colorful background, add sketch art and a short description of your dream. If the visual arts isn't your forte, then you can simply record a video of your self talking about how crazy your dream was, give it a caption and post it on the dream feed!

  • " A social networking app that enables you to utilize a sketchpad to create a visualization of the dream, as well as hash tags to connect with others who have had similar dreams."

You can also utilize hashtags to help describe your dream. Connect with people like you would with any other social network app. This app would become compatible on the iPhone, iPad and Android platforms.

If your confused about your dream you can ask people what they think the meaning of your dream is. Where it came from? Why the hell am I having dreams about monkeys in my living room…is this Jumanji?! Not only can you ask others about your dream, but you can rate peoples dream on a scale of 1-10, 10 being the craziest dream you've ever had! So what do you say IndieGoGo community, get on this DreamCatchR journey! 

The only way to truly understand how my app could potentially look is to recreate a dream, so an example would be: 

Last night I had this crazy dream that I flew to New Zealand on a private jet, went hiking on an elephant, sailed to Australia and ended up sipping martinis in Madagascar with a toy poodle named Pegasus. #insanedream #newzealand #australia #elephants #whatthehell #sailed #poodle #weirdestnightever

An example of something you could potentially create.

story:
A Hackable Computer balances the power of desktop devices with the beauty of sleek design, the open community, scalability of components, and rich playability of development boards. 

The Alpha Edition uses the same Intel 7th generation Core m3 processor as the latest MacBook. The Core m3 processor is the perfect choice for superior performance and low power consumption. Thanks to the excellent work of Intel and our engineering team, we have shrunken this computing monster from a laptop to the size of a phone.

 

We are shipping Windows 10 Pro this time but we have also added Linux Compatibility because we saw the different needs of users from our 1st Gen products.

Windows 10 Pro is Microsoft's enhanced operating system based on Windows 10 Home, which retains all the features of the home version, compatible with all Windows software, while providing greater security for industrial applications, remote control and development applications like remote desktop and management features. It makes the LattePanda Alpha / Delta product lineup in tune with the requirements of a productivity tool!

The Linux OS also has a rich development toolchain environment and resources for cutting-edge development runtimes, such as Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, and Automation etc. It inherits the UNIX system architecture, OPEN! It is a developer's most respected open development platform. We believe in the next few years, it will further promote a new industry in the rich applications.

Appreciating that we need a better way to interact between different platforms, we have introduced the Streaming Cable to complement the ultimate hackable computer; No more partitions, no more hassle. 

The Streaming Cable enables your Windows-enabled LattePanda device to act like a USB on a Mac or Linux system. Just plug & play into your Apple/Linux device! The PiP (Picture in Picture) form also eliminates the switching/use of dual mouse and HDMI to connect different systems for seamless interaction of two different systems. 

Connecting the LattePanda this way with your setup will also get rid of the need to partition your disk for Windows so you can research and develop Windows/IoT Smart devices easily! With the LattePanda Alpha and Delta, boost your productivity to new heights!

 

 

 

As a hackable device, dynamic form elevates your creation to a whole new level. 

This new case with an integrated fan vent is a sleek solution to cover your silicon. With its angular design and smooth metallic finish, your hackable computer will stand out whether on the back of your robot or on the top of your desk, all while protecting and cooling your LattePanda from the elements.

 

 

 

The LattePanda lineup covers a wide range of requirements from base-level performance all the way to the most sophisticated of needs. We strive to help our users find a suitable product in the LattePanda brand to fit their applications and target scenarios.  

On this campaign, we are kick starting the LattePanda Alpha and the LattePanda Delta!  

1. Alpha Edition - Generally refers to the leader in a wolf pack, α / Alpha. It will also be the leader in the LattePanda series, the most powerful in performance. Known as the leader of the Pandas, or "AlphaPanda" for short.

2. Delta Edition - Mathematical Character△; a triangle. In terms of product design, performance, price and power consumption, it signals a compromise between the three.

 

Note: we realize all backers do not have the same needs and might want more or less of a certain variant of the LattePanda Kits. Because of this, we will have, later in the campaign, an Add-on option for backers who wish to obtain larger quantities of a specific variant.

We still need your help to make this happen and hope you all can share and spread our campaign to as many corners of the internet as you can, we already really appreciate all the help you guys give us! Thanks.

 

 

 

 

 
 
 
 

Giving everyone a platform to express their feelings, digitally.

Some projects set out to just create a standalone product and fail to take into account the bigger picture.  

First, with its power, this device is sufficient to power all creators’ needs. Its slim profile is in tune with today’s times to maximize mobility, versatility and for you to utilize in the most compact of contraptions you may conceive. Its matt black finish is specifically there to give a soul to your project so that it looks like a finish product. Which brings us our purpose. Be it machine learning, high-speed data gathering, or super-fast graphics rendering all these require something that is versatile, dynamic and albeit come in the form factor where you do not have to drag around your computing powerhouse. We hope to give everyone a new platform for development, no matter what his or her background is. Essentially, we are engineers who want to use our experience to help people express their creativity. Our goal is to deliver products not just for the masses, but also for people just like us, who love to create! We make our products user-friendly and full rich features that even high-end users can appreciate for industry-related work, too. Down the line, we hope to diversify our product line-up even more with cool stuff that will not only be fun to use but also drive innovation!

story:
In order to get this project started, we are asking for help to raise funds to purchase a 3D printer.
This is required as the first stage in our development for the PetFeedr project.


The PetFeedr project itself will be an automatic and smart device controlled pet feeding solution; that will allow pet owners to feed and monitor their pets while they are out of the house.

Your contribution here will enable us to design the main device, using it to make prototype parts and the PetFeedr itself with varying styles and appearances.

The Printer we hope to fund is the Cubify Cube 3 as this will best meet our needs and requirements. This will cost us £900.

Should we only get around the £600 figure, we will purchase the Velleman K8200 3D Printer Kit, which is a self build kit coming in for the £600 mark.

The main PetFeedr project will be on crowdfunding sites once we have prototypes sorted using the 3D printer. 

*PetFeedr itself will be an automatic and Smart Device controlled Pet Feeding System, that we are very excited about.

One of the best things about this campaign is that for all contributions over £5, you will be able to get us to print items for you in 3D, for the cost of the materials and postage. 

An introduction to the PetFeedr Idea
The PetFeedr idea itself is a few months away to launch the planning and fundraising stages, but we think its important to give you, our first pre-development backers, some information about who and what 'PetFeedr' is!

PetFeedr is an idea from our founder, David, that helps pet owners feed and monitor their pets while they are out of the house.

Our device will be an easy to use attractive device, that will be controlled via smart device (iPhone or iPad - android devices at a later date), allowing you to feed your pets remotely, as well as being able to monitor the food they are taking in. Our device will initially be for dry food.
It will also have a camera that will enable you to watch your pets from around the world and see them when they are eating.

PetFeedr will not only be useful for Cats (as we are trailing it) but will also be useful for small dogs as well. 
Due to the unit being modular, we are able to create more add-ons for the device - for example a treat dispenser and water fountain - which will be added via a simple update.


The stage we are at just now:
We are currently in the process of building the hardware side. We are using the Raspberry Pi as our hardware controller with motors and cameras to enable the control and monitoring of the device.
The unit we have for testing successful completed a picture test,  an example of the capabilities is below.

Over the coming weeks, with the funding from this campaign, we will be creating prototypes of the design of the PetFeedr, as well as moving parts that we will use to create fully working prototypes. So stay tuned.


Perks:
£1 Contribution will get you our eternal thanks and gratitude.
£5 Contribution will get you our eternal thanks, gratitude and get your name on our wall of backers.
£10 Contribution will get you our eternal thanks, gratitude and get your name and a picture on our wall of backers.
£25 Contribution will get you on our wall of backers as well as a t-shirt (male/female).
£50 Contribution will get you on our wall of backers, our eternal thanks and gratitude and your name and company URL on our wall of backers and a t-shirt (male/female).
£100 Contribution will get you our eternal thanks and gratitude, a t-shirt (male or female), your picture on our wall of backers and your web address and company name on our wall of backers. You will also be helping us with the prototype designs as well.
£500 Contribution will get you our eternal thanks and gratitude, a t-shirt (male or female), company name and picture on our backers wall, and a 1st off the line Unit.  You will also get to be part of the team to help test the designs of the units as well.

Development Timeline:


More information and Crowdfunding information will be released in the New Year for PetFeedr itself

[ dave ]

story:
Who we are

We are a group of Italian guys and we've been friends since we were kids. Now that we've become adults and everyone has different jobs, lives in different cities, etc., we're struggling to keep in contact, organize a meeting or an event, plan a trip together and so on...

We realized that, even with all the technologies we have today, it's no easy task to keep our group alive, and this problem is quite common. So we started studying a possible solution to coordinate, plan and share information and activities in a small group.

Then what?

As a result, we're now developing a simple but effective app that allows to create, manage, organize and share the activities of small groups of individuals, like families, small offices, housemates, sport teams, groups of friends, etc...

Beehive?

Where do single individuals cooperate through an extremely simple, yet amazing, common structure that allows them to reach an incredible result?

Did you know the beehive is the most effective organization in the world?

That's where we got our inspiration from!

So, how does the app work?

                     

First of all, a group of users decide to associate and create their own BeeHive.

This way they create a structure they can use to communicate, share, plan coordinate and control their activities.

The app is made of simple modules, like the cells in a beehive, and the users, like bees, create and personalize the elements of these cells to organize and coordinate their activities.

In the different modules the users can add, share and update schedules, shopping lists, message boards, maps and locations, etc..

Thanks to the modular organizational structure, all the members of the beehive can contribute through their individual activities to reach their shared goal.

A few examples...

First, take our situation as an example. As I said, we're a group of friends, who were once living

together and now work in different cities. We want to keep our old group and our friendship alive. Instead of using different tools for different tasks and dispersive media where our small group would have no identity and would be harder to manage, we use a simple app on our smartphones or tablets.

We use the message module to communicate within the group and we keep in contact with all the other members. We decide to meet after a long time, and plan a weekend for snowboarding in the mountains. We use the calendar module to agree on a specific date. We keep in contact through messages and use the shopping list module to create lists of what we need and assign specific tasks to everyone. And here comes the weekend we've been waiting for, finally on the slopes... until someone gets lost. Using the gps module, we can share our positions and so we easily find ourselves together again...

Or you could think of a mother who needs to manage the shopping for her family, keep track of events and appointments, locate where her kids are, organize a birthday party for her husband...

Or think of a sport team planning the training, sharing updates and news, showing a position where they have to meet...

There is plenty of similar situations where the app could be extremely useful for small offices, housemates, coworkers, schoolmates, voluntary associations...

 

                       



What We Need 

We need $3,000 to cover basic start-up expenses such as:

- Server space

- Domains

- Web development

- Graphic design

- Software design

- Software developement

- Tax and legal consultancy

- Publishing on app stores

- Promotion and advertising

As this is a flexible funding project, we plan to build this app regardless of how much money we raise, but every little bit will help us get to our goal that much faster.

If we go beyond our goal, we'll use the money to improve the app with as many functions as possible, to promote it, to take it to more systems and platforms, etc...

After all, like a real beehive, as much as the bees contribute, as much as the hive can grow and develop!

What you get

Well, first of all, you have all of our heartily gratitude for your contribution and your support to the project, or even just your interest in it, having read until here!

Anyway, of course we know it's not enough and we want to give you more than just gratitude, so why don't you check the perks on this page to see what you can get?

And don't forget you’re not just buying something; you’re investing in an idea!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel that you cannot make a donation, you can still help us by spreading the word, contacting us with questions, suggestions or ideas that could improve the app, following our project and sharing this campaign:

Please tell your friends, family and colleagues  about this project! ...every kind of support will be very much appreciated!! :)

There is plenty of similar situations where the app could be extremely useful for small offices, housemates, coworkers, schoolmates, voluntary associations...
 
                        


What We Need 
We need $3,000 to cover basic start-up expenses such as:
- Server space
- Domains
- Web development
- Graphic design
- Software design
- Software developement
- Tax and legal consultancy
- Publishing on app stores
- Promotion and advertising
As this is a flexible funding project, we plan to build this app regardless of how much money we raise, but every little bit will help us get to our goal that much faster.
If we go beyond our goal, we'll use the money to improve the app with as many functions as possible, to promote it, to take it to more systems and platforms, etc...
After all, like a real beehive, as much as the bees contribute, as much as the hive can grow and develop!

What you get

Well, first of all, you have all of our heartily gratitude for your contribution and your support to the project, or even just your interest in it, having read until here!
Anyway, of course we know it's not enough and we want to give you more than just gratitude, so why don't you check the perks on this page to see what you can get? 
And don't forget you’re not just buying something; you’re investing in an idea!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you feel that you cannot make a donation, you can still help us by spreading the word, contacting us with questions, suggestions or ideas that could improve the app, following our project and sharing this campaign:
Please tell your friends, family and colleagues  about this project! ...every kind of support will be very much appreciated!! :)

story:
Summary

My name is Dennis Drenner and I’m a Baltimore, Maryland-based photojournalist. In just three weeks, I’m embarking on a new adventure, teaching a six week photojournalism course at the Royal University in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

 All of my expenses for the trip are being paid for by a Fulbright scholarship, but I’ve recently discovered that most of my students do not own and cannot afford cameras.  That’s where you all come in! I need funding to buy simple digital cameras for Cambodia’s next generation of photojournalists.


What We Need & What You Get

What I am looking for is a minimum of  $2500 to purchase used digital SLR cameras (and associated gear- cards, flashes, card readers, etc) to put into the hands of budding Cambodian photojournalists. The cameras will all be donated to the Royal University where they can be shared by multiple students for years to come.

I am also happy to accept donations of actual cameras. I am looking for digital SLR cameras with manual control over shutter speed and aperture. They can be old or new, just as long as they work!

While in Cambodia I will also be shooting for a book project, and in return for your donations I will be offering everything from email updates and Facebook kudos to signed photographic prints of my favorite images from the trip (you can check out my work at www.dennisdrenner.com to see if you like my style).



Why This Is Important

Some quick background on Cambodia: It is a small country of about 15 million people in Southeast Asia that is just beginning to pull itself back together after decades of conflict. The Vietnam War spilled over into the country, leading to the rise of the Khmer Rouge in the mid-70s.  This group perpetrated one of the worst genocides in history, taking the lives of about two million people through execution, forced labor and starvation.  The group made a special target of intellectuals and professionals, and by the end of the their rule in 1979, the country had lost much of its institutional knowledge in a wide range of fields, including everything from medicine and engineering to painting, music and photography.

With this in mind, my project is designed to breath new life into Cambodian photojournalism.  I hope to help inspire a new generation of Cambodian photographers so they can go out, tell their own stories and contribute to a robust media in their fledgling democracy. (Considering the 22% illiteracy rate among Cambodian adults, story telling with photography is especially important!) I will do this not only with my own teaching, but by forging new connections between my university in Cambodia and my photographic colleagues in the US and abroad, making it easier for other experienced photographers to follow in my footsteps.

In my free time, I will also be shooting my own pictures, with a goal of making significant progress towards a photography book on the country.

Money pledged toward the project will go towards the purchase of simple digital SLR cameras, which I will donate to the Royal University where they can be shared by multiple students. My own expenses are already covered by my grant, as mentioned above

Thank you for taking the  time to read about my project.  Any donation, no matter how small, will help!  Also -- please help spread the word!

story:
MakerDreams iNvent One®, your 3D printer designed to be easier, safer, more precise, elegant and inexpensive. 


Read about the iNventOne on:


Welcome to the future of self-production. 

MakerDreams wanted to bring into your home or office the best of 3D printers ensuring maximum reliability and accessibility to everyone. iNventOne was born from our passion for design and innovation, and offers you a comprehensive and affordable solution.

Why do we need your help. 

Our strong passion is our engine and we want to grow together with you to develop our many innovative ideas already on the agenda, including a line of brand-new products. Our ambition is to become in the world of 3D printers what Apple is for personal computers.

However, this is really a huge dream and that is why we need you, to accelerate the development process and help us to get our machines into production and bring them into your homes. 


Our concept

Our project is to make a 3D printer easy to use , nice and cheap, that all people can use it in any context . Print sizes are designed to meet all your needs, from small models to very large objects . Most printers 3d commercially is limited and not very usable. With iNventOne the entire system has been simplified and brought to a higher level, with the complete elimination of any kind of maintenance. Sometimes simplicity is worth much more.

We designed the entire product from scratch, chassis, electronics to handling systems that are all coordinated to ensure maximum innovation and perfection giving you a better user experience. Even environmental impact has its importance and this is the reason why the entire chassis is made of highly recyclable aluminum and other materials, without the use of toxic substances.


What makes iNvent One better?

When we began designing iNventOne, we have set a target price of less than € 1,000, while keeping high performance and quality of the product. By using techniques of mass production and study on the different parts, we brought the cost of professional 3D printing to a new level.

How far are we now?

The challenge with the iNvent project was to cram mechanical systems in a small enclosure thus maximizing the available print area and maintaining a pleasing appearance.  To do this, we chose to use the H-Bot system that allows to minimize space and simplify the mechanics.

One of the first things you should notice in iNvent is its enclosure. We wanted to create a device that was appealing and aesthetically pleasing. Clean and rounded lines are of primary importance for the creation of an aesthetically pleasing and long lasting appearance. For this reason, we have chosen an aluminum body, a highly recyclable material, because environmental impact is a very important factor. We have been working hard to minimize the view of screws or mechanical components, so that only the elegant line of iNventOne is visible.

Appearance does not make sense if print quality is not up to par. So we created a mechanical system that can provide smooth, high-resolution prints.

Construction methodology

All axes of movement are coupled to a single sheet metal part, thus reducing the need for calibration during assembly and ensuring a perfect product which can be immediately used once produced. The use of extruded aluminum profiles combined with sheet metal components produces a very rigid structure, while providing a stylish consumer product.

The study of the XY platform is one of the main strengths, but we are still working to improve it. Previous tests have shown that traditional or polymer systems had their limits. After intensive studies, we have chosen and simplified the H-Bot system, the perfect balance between speed, efficiency and reduced spaces. We focused on the creation of a resistant plate which was also fast to assemble, further lowering the costs of production.

 


Do you want a product that once connected is ready to print?

Well, that's just what we did - install the software, connect the power and USB, load a roll and click to print. All assembled printers are tested before leaving the production line, so they do not require special settings in addition to the initial calibration of the plane.

Do you dream of being able to produce models better than those of a professional prototyping but without its costs? – With one of the highest X, Y and Z resolutions available on the market and a thickness up to 100 microns (50 microns Z axis), it is possible to produce parts that are ready for use directly from the printer. Since it uses standard plastics it can immediately start creating real parts. We guarantee and recommend the use of the 1.75 mm PLA suitable for printing, durable and environmentally friendly since it is biodegradable.



The heart of iNventOne

The central part, the extruder, is certainly the most important: it is a MK7 model that has been modified to make it reliable. To give consistency to the 3D printer, we have created an enclosure cover (easily removable with magnets and a system of LEDs that illuminate the object that you are printing) that makes this part attractive and safe from any contact.

Closed enclosure

iNventOne has been designed as a closed enclosure to stabilize the printing environment, improve results and make the area safer. When the created part cools down (especially if ABS is used) irregularly or too quickly, it is compressed incorrectly, causing cracks and delaminations. Our enclosure serves several purposes: it prevents external thermal influences in your print by blocking drafts and keeping the internal temperature stable, it also creates a barrier to prevent any person from coming into contact with hot parts thus avoiding any type of injury, especially in the presence of children. 

Mechanics

Thanks to our experience in the field of mechanics, we have created an accurate and reliable product, choosing linear guidance systems with recirculating ball bearing carriers. These products are expensive but certainly the most suitable for this kind of application and do not require routine maintenance. 


A higher print volume

We have achieved a higher than average print volume, which can meet the needs of most of you, should you be professionals who need large prototypes or amateurs that create small pieces to be used in everyday life.

280x210x200 mm (11.02x8.2x7.8 inches) of space for your creativity, now everything can be reproduced.

Software

We currently use Cura 14.01 as print management program, but with your help we hope to create our exclusive software that will be provided free of charge and will be downloaded in the download section of our website. Our printer can also be used with the majority of open source programs such as Pronterface or Repetier-Host.



The features can be improved, everything depends on the final outcome of the fundraising campaign. Our development process never stops. We want to give you the opportunity to modify iNventOne at your convenience by changing the transparency of cover plates, changing the firmware, installing a heated plane, and anything else that may allow you to adapt the 3D printer to your personal needs.

MakerDreams is now an Italian startup, but during this campaign it will become a Ltd. based in London (UK), a strategic point which will allow us to have greater visibility and be closer to all our fans. Currently it is just the two of us, Luca Faggiotto and Federico Faggiotto, but we hope to expand quickly and add to our team a computer engineer and other contributors, as well as to make our products and services more efficient and faster thus bringing forward the next generation of 3D printers.

Not having investors and funds behind us, we hope that this crowdfunding campaign will be the springboard to make our dream come true with you. The timeline will help you understand the time required for production processes and where your investments will be addressed. We will do our utmost to reduce waiting times and we will keep you updated on the various stages.




What we hope this to be in the future

  • We are working to create a printing software to be used with iNventOne to provide more simplicity and functionality of use.

  • Currently the front panel of the prototype is easily removable by means of the magnets, but we are studying an opening system that does not obstruct the view and the extraction of the plexiglas plane.

  • The wiring coming to the extruder will be replaced by a flat cable with connectors to simplify installation and maintenance, so nothing will be visible because all the wires will pass inside the vertical aluminum section

  • An important step will be to implement a motherboard designed specifically for our printer.

  • With a new control board we would like to install a WiFi system and a SD card reader or USB port, so you can use the printer without a PC.

  • Create a plus version with the addition of a heated bed (which is already possible for those who wish to self-build a plane different from plexiglas).

  • Some of the pieces of iNventOne are printed by us (such as the enclosure and the coil holder) and this step takes time. To avoid this problem we would like to lean on firms to create professional molds and speed up production.

  • Various improvements to the firmware, expanding the team of MakerDreams.

  • For the future we want to start a program together with a charity association and give our printers to the greatest number of people in Africa, to help them to develop and construct useful items and implants for mutilated people. This is certainly our biggest and most important dream.


The prototype will be the same, if not better, as the consumer version that will come to you. All this will be possible if your help to our project will be as big as our dreams.


Stretch Goals

We are excited to offer some new stretch goals that will benefit all of our backers at the $999 pledge level and higher. As we gain more backers it gives us some better purchasing power, which in turn reduces our cost. We want to make sure to pass on the savings to you.


FAQs

- Why the shipping costs are not included?
Shipping costs may vary depending on the location and country. It is easier and less expensive for you to handle shipping out from indiegogo. When the campaign is finished, you will receive a link to our website where you can enter shipping information and pay the exact amount.

- How much will shipping cost me?
If you live within the European Union, the shipping cost is approximately $ 45. If you live anywhere else in the world, the shipping cost is approximately $ 180.

- What freight carrier do you use?
For shipping we use MBE (international) and other services for Europe. For this reason the orders will be always traceable.

- What print materials can I use?
We care about your health, so we must say that PLA is the best material to protect you and the environment as well as being easy to use and suitable for all prints. That said there is still the possibility of using any other material available.

- Which operating systems can I use with iNventOne?
It works with Mac, but also Windows and Linux. Available for download on our website.

- Do you have a heated bed?The created prototype does not have a heated bed, because it is not required by the PLA. However our motherboard is designed for it, and it will be installed to reach the final goal.

- How much does the material cost?
In addition to our wire coils, you can buy the material from the website that you prefer, but you might lose your warranty not having the certification of the product you are using.

- What power supply do you use?
The 12V power supply is internal to the printer and it has an European outlet. So if you have any problems, you will need an adapter easily affordable.

- Only USB connection?
To connect and use the 3D printer there is a USB A/USB B connection. We want to study a motherboard with WiFi and SD card reader.

- How will you deliver on time your printers having many orders?
iNventOne was designed to be constructed in three separate blocks and subsequently assembled, this makes the production simpler and faster.

- What are your plans if a part is defective or broken?
If the printer has really malfunctioning parts due to production, they will be replaced without any problems. You just have to send us the damaged piece and we will send you a new one.

story:
Drive to Save the Environment

Rewarding Drivers for Improving the relationship between their Automobile & the Environment. We help you make the roads safer, more affordable, and much more social.


Project Overview

The Fleet works by communicating with your car via a Bluetooth device that is easily installed under your car’s dash.  It instantly transforms your phone or tablet into a real-time Automotive Performance Manager, Maintenance Assistant, Error Diagnosis Tool, and Solution Finder.  The Fleet provides drivers with many more capabilities than traditional automotive scan tools for a fraction of the price.  Your vehicle information is accessible to you from any device.  

The Fleet's website TheFleetApp.com features a robust social component.  Share your struggles and victories with other drivers and use our network of automotive experts to help bring Diagnosed Vehicle Errors to resolution in record time.  We offer suggestions and incentives when vehicle performance is improved.  Win your competition and accumulate points for serious rewards!


Why The Fleet?

  • Improves vehicle performance.

  • Streamlines vehicle maintenance.

  • Suggests enhanced driving recommendations.

  • Recommends vehicle upgrades.

  • Saves you time & money.

  • Reduces carbon based vehicle waste.

  • Earns you rewards for improvements.


What is The Fleet trying to achieve?

Install a $25 "money-saver" Bluetooth diagnostic device in your automobile and never pay for a "$100 average" auto diagnostic ever again.

The Fleet will provide a *Free*, mobile app that allows drivers to easily read and interpret "real-time" vehicle performance and diagnostic information.

Observe, Maintain, Fix, Compete, Win!

Observe your vehicle performance and driver stats in real-time.

Maintain your car’s health for optimal performance.

Fix your ride in record time at a reduced cost.

Compete with other drivers and car enthusiasts.

Win serious prizes, save money, extend the life of your vehicle and the environment.


The Fleet offers drivers suggestions and incentives when vehicle performance is improved, helping user’s understand how their vehicles MPG impacts the environment. Drivers are able to instantly monetize fuel savings and understand how their driving habits correlate with MPG and the environment. This allows The Fleet to instantly reward excellent driving.


The Fleet Wants to Reward You!

  • Do you drive a vehicle(s) 1996 or newer?

  • Do you have a modern mobile device?

  • Do you want to improve the performance of your vehicle?

  • What do you know about your vehicles performance?

  • How does your driving style contribute to vehicle emissions?

  • Would you like to know?

  • Do you want to earn rewarded for driving?


About The Fleet and our Philosophy

With fuel prices at or near $3 a gallon we assume everyone would like to save money on fuel costs and automotive maintenance, while being stewards to the environment.  

Fleet Drivers know whats going on with their automobiles before going to the mechanic. Our Drivers preemptively diagnose their vehicle maintenance issues and are given recommendations on how to fix their automobiles at the lowest cost.

People want to be smarter drivers, earning incentives when they increase their vehicles’ performance.

We (The Fleet) want to be your Automotive Social Community!

We want to be the people facilitating the connection between your automobile & a reduced carbon footprint.  

The Fleet is a Web 2.0+ experience: Real-time meaningful data within a user-friendly app in a simplified, sexy view.


Assumptions about our Drivers

Drivers want to know in real time how their vehicles performance coupled with their “driving style” impacts their wallet.

Some drivers are Eco-conscious!

Our Drivers are smartphone owners who expect a fun, easy to use mobile app that delivers a meaningful experience.

Our drivers like to save time & money.

Our drivers want to be rewarded!


Our Single Most Important Thought...

Welcome to the One-Stop Shop for Everything Automotive 1996 and newer!

Earn rewards and become informed about your car's performance and  environmental impact in Real Time.


What is the Creative Spark?

For $25 you will earn Incentives for Driving while being Connected with your Automobile, and the Environment.

We're very proud to announce that The Fleet is the first comprehensive service to fully support Android and Apple mobile operating system.  We differentiate with others by the depth of automotive capabilities, intuitive navigation, Instant remote mechanic, and social focus.

Of course we had to make sure The Fleet was as friendly to the environment as possible. The case and packaging are fully recyclable and the internal components are produced according to international standards and regulations.

The Fleet will be international!  The first OBD2 devices will ship stateside in early April 2014 and internationally shortly after.

Most importantly, we really appreciate every bit of support! Become a Fleet Driver with a $25 pledge and join our community of rewarding excellence on the road.  We help you make the roads safer, more affordable, and much more social.

Improves vehicle performance.
Streamlines vehicle maintenance.
Suggests enhanced driving recommendations.
Recommends vehicle upgrades.
Saves you time & money.
Reduces carbon based vehicle waste.
Earns you rewards for improvements.
What is The Fleet trying to achieve?Install a $25 "money-saver" Bluetooth diagnostic device in your automobile and never pay for a "$100 average" auto diagnostic ever again.The Fleet will provide a *Free*, mobile app that allows drivers to easily read and interpret "real-time" vehicle performance and diagnostic information. Compete with other drivers and car enthusiasts. Drivers are able to instantly monetize fuel savings and understand how their driving habits correlate with MPG and the environment.
